author: John D. Stoll
title: In Auto Tariffs, a High-Stakes Game of Chicken
text:
Global auto makers have long touted their ability to turn on a dime: They can ramp up or dial back production in response to the market. They say they can even pivot from producing certain cars to SUVs at the same factory in a matter of weeks.
Now, President Donald Trump’s threatened tariffs on imported vehicles and parts could put that claim to the test.
How... RELATED VIDEO Two Trade Rules That Are Complicating Nafta Talks Negotiators from the U.S., Canada and Mexico are scrambling to reach a Nafta deal by July, but two proposals involving autos are complicating the talks. WSJ’s Shelby Holliday explains.
